entry.title: Karabakh Armenians brace for humanitarian catastrophe

media:group.media:title: Karabakh Armenians brace for humanitarian catastrophe
media:group.media:description:
๐Karabakh President Arayik Harutyunyan issued a formal disaster declaration as Azerbaijanโs seven-month blockade continues. ๐All public transport has been suspended in Karabakh amid widespread fuel shortages caused by Azerbaijanโs blockade. ๐The International Committee of the Red Cross said it is currently unable to bring aid to Karabakh from Azerbaijan via the town of Aghdam. ๐Armenian Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan said he refused to discuss the issue of bringing aid to Karabakh via Aghdam at his most recent meeting with Azerbaijani President Ilham Aliyev. ๐In an exclusive interview with Spin magazine, renowned Armenian American musician and activist Serj Tankian called on the United States to do more to support Karabakh.

entry.title: Ererouyk: Preserving an Armenian architectural masterpiece

media:group.media:title: Ererouyk: Preserving an Armenian architectural masterpiece
media:group.media:description:
Gaianรจ Casnati, a member of Europa Nostra pan-European federation for cultural heritage, and Emma Harutyunyan, Associate Professor at the National University of Architecture and Construction of Armenia, sat down with CivilNet on the sidelines of the Armenian Society of Fellows conference in Dilijan, Armenia, to discuss the preservation of Ererouyk in Armeniaโs Shirak Region. The archeological site, which won a European Heritage Award (Europa Nostra Award) in 2023, is one of the earliest surviving Christian monuments in Armenia, and was added to the UNESCO World Heritage Tentative List in 1995. Casnati and Harutyunyan discuss why Ererouyk is a unique example of Armenian architecture, and the various efforts to restore and preserve the site.
Casnati and Harutyunyan also invite watchers to vote in Europa Nostraโs 2023 Public Choice Award, where Ererouyk is also participating. The winner will be announced at the European Heritage Awards Ceremony on 28 September 2023 in Venice, and will receive a monetary prize of โฌ10.000.
You can vote here https://vote.europanostra.org/

entry.title: Mass rallies against Azerbaijanโs blockade in Yerevan and Stepanakert

media:group.media:title: Mass rallies against Azerbaijanโs blockade in Yerevan and Stepanakert
media:group.media:description:
๐The foreign ministers of Armenia, Azerbaijan, and Russia will meet in Moscow tomorrow for another round of negotiations. ๐Organizers are planning simultaneous mass rallies in Yerevan and Stepanakert tomorrow to call on Azerbaijan to lift its seven-month blockade of Nagorno-Karabakh. ๐The International Committee of the Red Cross evacuated 11 people from Nagorno-Karabakh to Armenia for medical treatment. ๐Russian peacekeepers refused to allow a group of Nagorno-Karabakh residents to enter the region from Armenia via the Lachin corridor. ๐Armeniaโs tech entrepreneurs gathered at Lake Sevan for this yearโs Sevan Startup Summit.
Credits: Ruptly

ิฑึีคีฅีถ ีฟีกีฝีถ ึ ึ ีง, ีซีถีน ิตึึีกีถีธึีด ีจีถีฉีกีถีธึีด ีฅีถ ีฐีกีพีกึีถีฅึ ึ ีฅึีฉีฅึี ิผีกีนีซีถีซ ีดีซีปีกีถึึีถ ีกีบีกีทึีปีกึีกีฏีฅีฌีธึ ึ ิฑึึีกีญีซีถ ึ ีฃีถีธึีฉีตีธึีถ ีฐีกีฝึีถีฅีฌีธึ ีฏีธีนีฅึีธีพึ ีีกีฝีถีกีฏีซึีถีฅึีจ ีฐีกีพีกึีธึีด ีฅีถ ีบีกึีฅีถ ึ ีกีผีกีปีซีถ ีกีถีฐึีกีชีฅีทีฟีธึีฉีตีกีถ ีบีกึีกีฃีกีถีฅึ ีิฑิฟ-ีซ ีคึีธีทีซ ีถีฅึึีธ ิฑึึีกีญ ีธึีฒีกึีฏีฅีฌีธึ ีถีบีกีฟีกีฏีธีพึ ีีฅีบีธึีฟีกีชีซ ีบีกีฟึีกีฝีฟีดีกีถ ีจีถีฉีกึึีธึีด ีฐีกีตีฟีถีซ ีคีกึีฑีกีพ, ีธึ ีกีฏึีซีกีตีซ ีดีกีฝีถีกีฏีซึีถีฅึีซ ีฐีฅีฟ ีฐีกีถีคีซีบีฅีฌ ีง ีิฑิฟ-ีซ ีดีทีฟีกีฏีกีถ ีฐีกีดีกีฏีกึีฃีธีฒีซ ีบีกีทีฟีธีถีกีฏีกีฟีกึ ีีซีฌีฝ ีึีธีฉีจึ ีีซีพีซีฌีีฅีฉีจ ีถีธึีตีถีบีฅีฝ ีดีซ ึีกีถีซ ึ ึ ีง, ีซีถีน ึีธึีฑีธึีด ีง ีฏีกีบ ีฐีกีฝีฟีกีฟีฅีฌ ีิฑิฟ-ีซ ีีกึีฅีถีซ ีฐีกีดีกีทีญีกึีฐีกีตีซีถ ีฎึีกีฃึีซ ีฐีกีฒีธึีคีกีฏึีธึีฉีตีกีถ ีขีกีชีถีซ ีฐีฅีฟ, ีฝีกีฏีกีตีถ ีฐีกึึีธึีดีถีฅึีจ ีดีถีธึีด ีฅีถ ีกีถีบีกีฟีกีฝีญีกีถึ

entry.title: A walk through the streets of blockaded Karabakh

media:group.media:title: A walk through the streets of blockaded Karabakh
media:group.media:description:
Today, it is rare to see cars passing through the streets in Nagorno Karabakh (Artsakh). The region has been under a total blockade for more than seven months. Last month, Azerbaijan also banned the entry of humanitarian goods to Karabakh. Without fuel, Stepanakertโs public transportation is almost non-existent, and regional transportation is operating with a limited schedule. Let's take a walk through Stepanakertโs central streets to get a glimpse of the peopleโs daily reality.
ะกะตะณะพะดะฝั ะฒ ะกัะตะฟะฐะฝะฐะบะตััะต ัะตะดะบะพ ะผะพะถะฝะพ ัะฒะธะดะตัั ะผะฐัะธะฝั. ะะพะปะตะต ัะตะผะธ ะผะตัััะตะฒ ะััะฐั ะฝะฐั ะพะดะธััั ะฒ ะฑะปะพะบะฐะดะต, ะฐ ะฒ ะธัะฝะต ะะทะตัะฑะฐะนะดะถะฐะฝ ะฟะพะปะฝะพัััั ะทะฐะฟัะตัะธะป ะดะฒะธะถะตะฝะธะต ะปัะดะตะน ะธ ะณััะทะพะฒ ะฟะพ ะะฐัะธะฝัะบะพะผั ะบะพัะธะดะพัั. ะะตะท ัะพะฟะปะธะฒะฐ ะพะฑัะตััะฒะตะฝะฝัะน ััะฐะฝัะฟะพัั ะฟะพััะธ ะฝะต ัะฐะฑะพัะฐะตั. ะะฐะผะตัะฐ CivilNet ะทะฐัะธะบัะธัะพะฒะฐะปะฐ ัะปะธัั ะกัะตะฟะฐะฝะฐะบะตััะฐ ัะตะณะพะดะฝั.
ีึีปีกึีกีฏีดีกีถ ีบีกีฟีณีกีผีธีพ ิฑึึีกีญีธึีด ีฅึีฉึีฅีฏีธีฒ ีดีฅึีฅีถีกีถีฅึ ีฐีกีฆีพีกีคีฅีบ ีฏีกึีฅีฌีซ ีง ีฟีฅีฝีถีฅีฌึ ี ีธีฉ ีกีดีฝีซึ ีกีพีฅีฌีซ ิฑึึีกีญีจ ีทึีปีกึีกีฏีพีกีฎ ีง, ีฐีธึีถีซีฝีซ 15-ีซึ ีงีฌ ีกีคึีขีฅีปีกีถีกีฏีกีถ ีฏีธีฒีดีจ ีถีกึ ีฐีธึีดีกีถีซีฟีกึ ีขีฅีผีถีฅึีซ ีดีธึีฟึีถ ีง ีกึีฃีฅีฌีฅีฌโค ีนีฏีก ีคีซีฆีพีกีผีฅีฌีซึ, ีนีฏีก ีถีกึ ีฃีกีฆ ีกึีคีฅีถ ีนีธึีฝ ีกีดีซีฝ: ีีฟีฅึีกีถีกีฏีฅึีฟีธึีด ีฐีกีถึีกีตีซีถ ีฟึีกีถีฝีบีธึีฟีจ ีฃึีฅีฉีฅ ีนีซ ีฃีธึีฎีธึีด, ีซีฝีฏ ีดีซีปึีทึีปีกีถีกีตีซีถ ีฟึีกีถีฝีบีธึีฟีจ ีฃีธึีฎีธึีด ีง ีขีกีฆีดีกีฉีซีพ ีฏึีณีกีฟีธึีดีถีฅึีธีพ, ีทีธึีฟีธีพ ีคีก ีงีฌ ีนีซ ีฌีซีถีซ:
